N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 149-2.6 - Expenditure check

State Regulations
(a) A school
district which spends less in local funds during the current year than in the
base year for the purposes of conducting programs to improve student attendance
and student retention shall have its apportionment of comprehensive operating
aid under subdivision 12 of section
3602
of the

Education Law reduced in an amount equal to such deficiency in the current year
or the succeeding school year. In addition, a district which spends any part of
its total annual setaside attributable to attendance improvement and dropout
prevention in an unauthorized manner in the base year shall have its current
year apportionment of comprehensive operating aid reduced in an amount equal to
the amount of such unauthorized expenditures. In no event shall the reductions
assessed pursuant to this section on the current year apportionment of
comprehensive operating aid, be deducted from the setasides required pursuant
to this Part and paragraphs f, g, and h of subdivision 12 of section
3602
of the

Education Law. (b) Beginning with
the 1994-95 school year, the city school district of the City of New York shall
allocate at least one-third of any increase from base year levels in funds set
aside for attendance improvement and dropout prevention to community-based
organizations. Any increase required to community-based organizations must be
in addition to allocations provided to community-based organizations in the
base year. Notes
